title: Rains to persist across Phl

organizations.name: philippine atmospheric, geophysical and astronomical services administration

text:
Rains to persist across Phl By Helen Flores (The Philippine Star)  00am 
MANILA, Philippines - Light to moderate rains will persist in various parts of the country despite the weakening of the tail-end of a cold front, the state weather bureau said yesterday. 
Parts of Metro Manila, Southern Tagalog, Bohol, Cebu, Davao and Caraga regions experienced rainshowers due to isolated thunderstorms and the easterlies affecting the eastern part of the country, according to the Philippine Atmospheric, Geophysical and Astronomical Services Administration (PAGASA). 
The extended weather forecast showed that the country will experience rainshowers until Wednesday. 
PAGASA said cloudy skies with light to moderate rains and isolated thunderstorms will prevail in Cagayan Valley, Bicol, Eastern Visayas, Caraga, Davao, Aurora and Quezon. 
Partly cloudy to cloudy skies with isolated rains or thunderstorms will be experienced in Metro Manila and the rest of the country. 
PAGASA said the coastal waters of Luzon and the eastern seaboards of the Visayas and Mindanao will be moderate to rough due to strong winds blowing from the east and northeast. Headlines ( Article MRec ), pagematch: 1, sectionmatch: 1
